Constructors

AudioManager(AudioThread, ResourceStore<byte[]>, ResourceStore<byte[]>)

Constructs an AudioStore given a track resource store, and a sample resource store.

public AudioManager(AudioThread audioThread, ResourceStore<byte[]> trackStore, ResourceStore<byte[]> sampleStore)

Parameters

audioThread AudioThread

The host's audio thread.

trackStore ResourceStore<byte[]>

The resource store containing all audio tracks to be used in the future.

sampleStore ResourceStore<byte[]>

The sample store containing all audio samples to be used in the future.

Fields

AudioDevice

The preferred audio device we should use. A value of Empty denotes the OS default.

public readonly Bindable<string> AudioDevice

Field Value

Bindable<string>

BASS_INTERNAL_DEVICE_COUNT

The number of BASS audio devices preceding the first real audio device. Consisting of ManagedBass.Bass.NoSoundDevice and bass_default_device.

protected const int BASS_INTERNAL_DEVICE_COUNT = 2

Field Value

int

EventScheduler

The scheduler used for invoking publicly exposed delegate events.

public Scheduler EventScheduler

Field Value

Scheduler

SampleMixer

The global mixer which all samples are routed into by default.

public readonly AudioMixer SampleMixer

Field Value

AudioMixer

TrackMixer

The global mixer which all tracks are routed into by default.

public readonly AudioMixer TrackMixer

Field Value

AudioMixer

VolumeSample

Volume of all samples played game-wide.

public readonly BindableDouble VolumeSample

Field Value

BindableDouble

VolumeTrack

Volume of all tracks played game-wide.

public readonly BindableDouble VolumeTrack

Field Value

BindableDouble

Properties

AudioDeviceNames

The names of all available audio devices.

public IEnumerable<string> AudioDeviceNames { get; }

Property Value

IEnumerable<string>

Remarks

This property does not contain the names of disabled audio devices.

IsLoaded

Whether this component has finished loading its resources.

public override bool IsLoaded { get; }

Property Value

bool

Samples

The manager component responsible for audio samples (e.g. sound effects).

public ISampleStore Samples { get; }

Property Value

ISampleStore

Tracks

The manager component responsible for audio tracks (e.g. songs).

public ITrackStore Tracks { get; }

Property Value

ITrackStore

UsingGlobalMixer

Whether a global mixer is being used for audio routing. For now, this is only the case on Windows when using shared mode WASAPI initialisation.

public IBindable<bool> UsingGlobalMixer { get; }

Property Value

IBindable<bool>

Methods

CheckForDeviceChanges(ImmutableArray<DeviceInfo>)

Check whether any audio device changes have occurred.

Changes supported are:

  • A new device is added
  • An existing device is Enabled/Disabled or set as Default
protected virtual bool CheckForDeviceChanges(ImmutableArray<DeviceInfo> previousDevices)

Parameters

previousDevices ImmutableArray<DeviceInfo>

The previous audio devices array.

Returns

bool

Whether a change was detected.

Remarks

This method is optimised to incur the lowest overhead possible.

CreateAudioMixer(string)

Creates a new AudioMixer.

public AudioMixer CreateAudioMixer(string identifier = null)

Parameters

identifier string

An identifier displayed on the audio mixer visualiser.

Returns

AudioMixer

Remarks

Channels removed from this AudioMixer fall back to the global SampleMixer.

GetAllDevices() 

protected virtual ImmutableArray<DeviceInfo> GetAllDevices()

ImmutableArray<DeviceInfo>

GetSampleStore(IResourceStore<byte[]>, AudioMixer)

Obtains the SampleStore corresponding to a given resource store. Returns the global SampleStore if no resource store is passed.

public ISampleStore GetSampleStore(IResourceStore<byte[]> store = null, AudioMixer mixer = null)

Parameters

store IResourceStore<byte[]>

The IResourceStore<T> of which to retrieve the SampleStore.

mixer AudioMixer

The AudioMixer to use for samples created by this store. Defaults to the global SampleMixer.

Returns

ISampleStore

Remarks

By default, .wav and .ogg extensions will be automatically appended to lookups on the returned store if the lookup does not correspond directly to an existing filename. Additional extensions can be added via AddExtension(string).

GetTrackStore(IResourceStore<byte[]>, AudioMixer)

Obtains the TrackStore corresponding to a given resource store. Returns the global TrackStore if no resource store is passed.

public ITrackStore GetTrackStore(IResourceStore<byte[]> store = null, AudioMixer mixer = null)

Parameters

store IResourceStore<byte[]>

The IResourceStore<T> of which to retrieve the TrackStore.

mixer AudioMixer

The AudioMixer to use for tracks created by this store. Defaults to the global TrackMixer.

Returns

ITrackStore

Events

OnLostDevice

Is fired whenever an audio device is lost and provides its name.
